description.value:
Trigger The PCs arrive at the island

Effect A fiery point of light appears in the sky at the center of the Eclipse, swiftly growing in size as it becomes apparent that a meteor is hurtling toward the island. The Eclipse rolls initiative.

details.description: The Eclipse is located high in the sky, manifesting as an eclipsed sun.
details.disable: Reduce the Eclipse to 0 HP, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (10th level; counteract DC 39) to counteract the Eclipse (once it's in range)

publication.title: Pathfinder #192: Worst of All Possible Worlds

details.routine: (1 action) The Eclipse heals [[/r 50[healing]]] points of damage, retreats upward from PCs if any have approached (as determined by its Distance Score), then unleashes a meteor down on the island below. The meteor explodes upon striking the island, creating a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] that inflicts @Damage[8d6[fire],4d6[bludgeoning]]{8d6 fire damage and 4d6 bludgeoning damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:41|basic:true|traits:damaging-effect] save) to all creatures caught in the blast. The eclipse targets these strikes to catch as many PCs in the blast as it can each time—while it doesn't seek to damage a bulâ€‘gae, it won't worry about catching one or both in the area of effect if that spot is the most advantageous to striking the most possible PCs.
